SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

net.xeoh.plugins.base.annotations.events
Annotation Type PluginLoaded

@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface PluginLoaded

Called when a plugin of the given interface was registered. For example, if you want to be called when a new Plugin of the type StorageService was added, you could write:

@PluginLoaded
public void checkPlugin(StorageService service) { ... }

This method is especially useful in the case of plugins added in the future. Sometimes you rely on a plugin which is not there in the early stage of your application lifetime. If you depended on it with InjectPlugin, you either would not see it, or your own plugin would be suspended until it was loaded. Using the PluginLoaded you can start up anyway and wait for it in this callback-like mechanism.

Note: Methods annotated with this have to be PUBLIC, otherwise they won't be found.

Author:
Ralf Biedert
